code:
export const sortingItems = [{
  id: 1,
  name: "Plastic Bottles",
  category: "recyclable",
  instructions: "Rinse, remove caps, and place in recycling bin. Labels can stay on.",
  tips: "Crush bottles to save space in your recycling bin.",
  icon: "plastic-bottle.svg"
}, {
  id: 2,
  name: "Cardboard",
  category: "recyclable",
  instructions: "Break down boxes and keep dry. Remove tape and staples if possible.",
  tips: "Pizza boxes with food residue should go in compost or trash.",
  icon: "cardboard.svg"
}, {
  id: 3,
  name: "Food Scraps",
  category: "compost",
  instructions: "Collect in a compost bin or freezer until ready for drop-off/pickup.",
  tips: "Most fruits, vegetables, eggshells, coffee grounds, and tea bags can be composted.",
  icon: "food-waste.svg"
}, {
  id: 4,
  name: "Aluminum Cans",
  category: "recyclable",
  instructions: "Rinse out residue and place in recycling bin.",
  tips: "Aluminum can be recycled indefinitely without quality loss.",
  icon: "can.svg"
}, {
  id: 5,
  name: "Glass Bottles",
  category: "recyclable",
  instructions: "Rinse clean and remove lids. Labels can remain.",
  tips: "Different colors of glass may need to be separated in some locations.",
  icon: "glass-bottle.svg"
}, {
  id: 6,
  name: "Plastic Bags",
  category: "special",
  instructions: "Return to grocery stores with plastic bag collection programs.",
  tips: "Most curbside programs do not accept plastic bags as they jam sorting machinery.",
  icon: "plastic-bag.svg"
}, {
  id: 7,
  name: "Batteries",
  category: "special",
  instructions: "Do not place in regular trash or recycling. Take to designated collection points.",
  tips: "Many electronics stores offer free battery recycling.",
  icon: "battery.svg"
}, {
  id: 8,
  name: "Yard Waste",
  category: "compost",
  instructions: "Collect leaves, grass clippings, and small branches for municipal composting.",
  tips: "Check if your area requires paper bags or accepts plastic bags for yard waste.",
  icon: "yard-waste.svg"
}, {
  id: 9,
  name: "Styrofoam",
  category: "landfill",
  instructions: "Most areas require styrofoam to go in the trash.",
  tips: "Some specialized recycling facilities accept clean styrofoam - check locally.",
  icon: "styrofoam.svg"
}, {
  id: 10,
  name: "Electronics",
  category: "special",
  instructions: "Take to e-waste recycling events or designated drop-off locations.",
  tips: "Many manufacturers offer take-back programs for their products.",
  icon: "electronics.svg"
}, {
  id: 11,
  name: "Paper",
  category: "recyclable",
  instructions: "Keep clean and dry. Staples are usually okay, but remove large plastic clips.",
  tips: "Shredded paper should be contained in a paper bag before recycling.",
  icon: "paper.svg"
}, {
  id: 12,
  name: "Coffee Cups",
  category: "landfill",
  instructions: "Most disposable coffee cups have a plastic lining and cannot be recycled.",
  tips: "Use a reusable coffee cup instead to reduce waste.",
  icon: "coffee-cup.svg"
}, {
  id: 13,
  name: "Light Bulbs",
  category: "special",
  instructions: "CFL and fluorescent bulbs contain mercury and need special handling.",
  tips: "LEDs and incandescent bulbs can typically go in regular trash.",
  icon: "light-bulb.svg"
}, {
  id: 14,
  name: "Plastic Utensils",
  category: "landfill",
  instructions: "Most plastic cutlery is not recyclable and should go in trash.",
  tips: "Consider carrying reusable utensils to reduce waste.",
  icon: "utensils.svg"
}, {
  id: 15,
  name: "Metal Cans",
  category: "recyclable",
  instructions: "Rinse clean. Labels can stay on. Flatten if space is an issue.",
  tips: "Check if the lid should be attached or separated in your area.",
  icon: "can.svg"
}];

sourcesContent:
export const sortingItems = [
  {
    id: 1,
    name: "Plastic Bottles",
    category: "recyclable",
    instructions: "Rinse, remove caps, and place in recycling bin. Labels can stay on.",
    tips: "Crush bottles to save space in your recycling bin.",
    icon: "plastic-bottle.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    name: "Cardboard",
    category: "recyclable",
    instructions: "Break down boxes and keep dry. Remove tape and staples if possible.",
    tips: "Pizza boxes with food residue should go in compost or trash.",
    icon: "cardboard.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    name: "Food Scraps",
    category: "compost",
    instructions: "Collect in a compost bin or freezer until ready for drop-off/pickup.",
    tips: "Most fruits, vegetables, eggshells, coffee grounds, and tea bags can be composted.",
    icon: "food-waste.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    name: "Aluminum Cans",
    category: "recyclable",
    instructions: "Rinse out residue and place in recycling bin.",
    tips: "Aluminum can be recycled indefinitely without quality loss.",
    icon: "can.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    name: "Glass Bottles",
    category: "recyclable",
    instructions: "Rinse clean and remove lids. Labels can remain.",
    tips: "Different colors of glass may need to be separated in some locations.",
    icon: "glass-bottle.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 6,
    name: "Plastic Bags",
    category: "special",
    instructions: "Return to grocery stores with plastic bag collection programs.",
    tips: "Most curbside programs do not accept plastic bags as they jam sorting machinery.",
    icon: "plastic-bag.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 7,
    name: "Batteries",
    category: "special",
    instructions: "Do not place in regular trash or recycling. Take to designated collection points.",
    tips: "Many electronics stores offer free battery recycling.",
    icon: "battery.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 8,
    name: "Yard Waste",
    category: "compost",
    instructions: "Collect leaves, grass clippings, and small branches for municipal composting.",
    tips: "Check if your area requires paper bags or accepts plastic bags for yard waste.",
    icon: "yard-waste.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 9,
    name: "Styrofoam",
    category: "landfill",
    instructions: "Most areas require styrofoam to go in the trash.",
    tips: "Some specialized recycling facilities accept clean styrofoam - check locally.",
    icon: "styrofoam.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 10,
    name: "Electronics",
    category: "special",
    instructions: "Take to e-waste recycling events or designated drop-off locations.",
    tips: "Many manufacturers offer take-back programs for their products.",
    icon: "electronics.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 11,
    name: "Paper",
    category: "recyclable",
    instructions: "Keep clean and dry. Staples are usually okay, but remove large plastic clips.",
    tips: "Shredded paper should be contained in a paper bag before recycling.",
    icon: "paper.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 12,
    name: "Coffee Cups",
    category: "landfill",
    instructions: "Most disposable coffee cups have a plastic lining and cannot be recycled.",
    tips: "Use a reusable coffee cup instead to reduce waste.",
    icon: "coffee-cup.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 13,
    name: "Light Bulbs",
    category: "special",
    instructions: "CFL and fluorescent bulbs contain mercury and need special handling.",
    tips: "LEDs and incandescent bulbs can typically go in regular trash.",
    icon: "light-bulb.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 14,
    name: "Plastic Utensils",
    category: "landfill",
    instructions: "Most plastic cutlery is not recyclable and should go in trash.",
    tips: "Consider carrying reusable utensils to reduce waste.",
    icon: "utensils.svg"
  },
  {
    id: 15,
    name: "Metal Cans",
    category: "recyclable",
    instructions: "Rinse clean. Labels can stay on. Flatten if space is an issue.",
    tips: "Check if the lid should be attached or separated in your area.",
    icon: "can.svg"
  }
];
